page.title: 08The Fishing Industry
page.content: Based in St.Peter Port harbour there are about 40 boats varying from seven metres to eighteen metres in length, the biggest one fishing up to 40 miles from Guernsey's coast in up to 80 metres depth. The industry is based mainly on potting for crabs. The 2,000 tonnes catch is worth Â£3 million and is almost entirely exported: 60% to France, 30% to Spain and 10% to U.K. A small number of fishermen handline for pollack, longline for conger, bass or flatfish and trawl for flatfish. There are a few divers who fish commercially, mainly for scallops. The industry provides employment for about 200 people.
